answerText: The Changeling[10] The Changeling was written by William Rowley and this Jacobean dramatist, whose other works include A Chaste Maid in Cheapside, Women Beware Women, and A Game of Chess. Contemporary work believes that he, not Cyril Torneur, wrote The Revenger's Tragedy.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Rutgers and Virginia A | 18 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Antonio and Franciscus, who feigned foolishness and madness so as to seduce Isabella, are originally accused of the central murder of this play, which occurs when a servant shows Alonzo de Piracquo secret passages. For 10 points: [10] Name this play, in which Beatrice-Joanna induces Deflores to kill her fianceÃÅ, so that she might wed Alsemero, but the two die together after their affair is discovered by Alsemero and Tomazo seeks revenge for his brother.
